sarkas.tools.postprocessing module¶

Module for calculating physical quantities from Sarkas checkpoints.

plot(longitudinal=True, show=False, dispersion=False)[source]¶

Plot velocity fluctuations correlation functions and save the figure.

Parameters

  • longitudinal (bool) – Flag for plotting longitudinal or transverse correlation function. Default=True.

  • show (bool) – Flag for prompting the plots to screen. Default=False

  • dispersion (bool) – Flag for plotting the collective mode dispersion. Default=False

  • potential_matrix (ndarray) – Potential parameters.

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.autocorrelationfunction(At)[source]¶

Calculate the autocorrelation function of the array input.

\[A(\tau) = \sum_j^D \sum_i^T A_j(t_i)A_j(t_i + \tau)\]

where \(D\) is the number of dimensions and \(T\) is the total length of the simulation.

Parameters

At (ndarray) – Observable to autocorrelate. Shape=(no_dim, no_steps).

Returns

ACF – Autocorrelation function of At.

Return type

array

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.autocorrelationfunction_1D(At)[source]¶

Calculate the autocorrelation function of the input.

\[A(\tau) = \sum_i^T A(t_i)A(t_i + \tau)\]

where \(T\) is the total length of the simulation.

Parameters

At (array) – Array to autocorrelate. Shape=(no_steps).

Returns

ACF – Autocorrelation function of At.

Return type

array

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_Sk(nkt, ka_list, ka_counts, species_np, no_dumps)[source]¶

Calculate \(S_{ij}(k)\) at each saved timestep.

Parameters

  • nkt (ndarray, cmplx) – Density fluctuations of all species. Shape = ( no_species, no_dumps, no_ka_values)

  • ka_list – List of \(k\) indices in each direction with corresponding magnitude and index of ka_counts. Shape=(no_ka_values, 5)

  • ka_counts (array) – Number of times each \(k\) magnitude appears.

  • species_np (array) – Array with number of particles of each species.

  • no_dumps (int) – Number of dumps.

Returns

Sk_all – Array containing \(S_{ij}(k)\). Shape=(no_Sk, no_ka_values, no_dumps)

Return type

ndarray

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_Skw(nkt, ka_list, ka_counts, species_np, no_dumps, dt, dump_step)[source]¶

Calculate the Fourier transform of the correlation function of nkt.

Parameters

  • nkt (nkarray, complex) – Particles’ density or velocity fluctuations. Shape = ( no_species, no_k_list, no_dumps)

  • ka_list (list) – List of \(k\) indices in each direction with corresponding magnitude and index of ka_counts. Shape=(no_ka_values, 5)

  • ka_counts (array) – Number of times each \(k\) magnitude appears.

  • species_np (array) – Array with one element giving number of particles.

  • no_dumps (int) – Number of dumps.

Returns

Skw – DSF/CCF of each species and pair of species. Shape = (no_skw, no_ka_values, no_dumps)

Return type

ndarray

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_elec_current(vel, sp_charge, sp_num)[source]¶

Calculate the total electric current and electric current of each species.

Parameters

  • vel (array) – Particles’ velocities.

  • sp_charge (array) – Charge of each species.

  • sp_num (array) – Number of particles of each species.

Returns

  • Js (ndarray) – Electric current of each species. Shape = (no_species, no_dim, no_dumps)

  • Jtot (ndarray) – Total electric current. Shape = (no_dim, no_dumps)

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_moment_ratios(moments, species_np, no_dumps)[source]¶

Take the ratio of the velocity moments.

Parameters

  • moments (ndarray) – Velocity moments of each species per direction at each time step.

  • no_dumps (int) – Number of saved timesteps.

  • species_np (array) – Number of particles of each species.

Returns

ratios – Ratios of high order velocity moments with respoect the 2nd moment. Shape=(no_species,2, no_dumps)

Return type

ndarray

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_moments(vel, nbins, species_np)[source]¶

Calculate the even moments of the velocity distributions.

Parameters

  • vel (ndarray) – Particles’ velocity at each time step.

  • nbins (int) – Number of bins to be used for the distribution.

  • species_np (array) – Number of particles of each species.

Returns

moments – 2nd, 4th, 8th moment of the velocity distributions. Shape=( no_dumps, 9 * len(species_np))

Return type

ndarray

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_nk(pos_data, k_list)[source]¶

Calculate the instantaneous microscopic density \(n(k)\) defined as

\[n_{A} ( k ) = \sum_i^{N_A} \exp [ -i \mathbf k \cdot \mathbf r_{i} ]\]
Parameters

  • pos_data (ndarray) – Particles’ position scaled by the box lengths. Shape = ( no_dumps, no_dim, tot_no_ptcls)

  • k_list (list) – List of \(k\) indices in each direction with corresponding magnitude and index of ka_counts. Shape=(no_ka_values, 5)

Returns

nk – Array containing \(n(k)\).

Return type

array

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_nkt(fldr, no_dumps, dump_step, species_np, k_list)[source]¶

Calculate density fluctuations \(n(k,t)\) of all species.

\[n_{A} ( k, t ) = \sum_i^{N_A} \exp [ -i \mathbf k \cdot \mathbf r_{i}(t) ]\]

where \(N_A\) is the number of particles of species \(A\).

Parameters

  • fldr (str) – Name of folder containing particles data.

  • no_dumps (int) – Number of saved timesteps.

  • dump_step (int) – Timestep interval saving.

  • species_np (array) – Number of particles of each species.

  • k_list (list) – List of :math: k vectors.

Returns

nkt – Density fluctuations. Shape = ( no_species, no_dumps, no_ka_values)

Return type

ndarray, complex

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_pressure_tensor(pos, vel, acc, species_mass, species_np, box_volume)[source]¶

Calculate the pressure tensor.

Parameters

  • pos (ndarray) – Particles’ positions.

  • vel (ndarray) – Particles’ velocities.

  • acc (ndarray) – Particles’ accelerations.

  • species_mass (array) – Mass of each species.

  • species_np (array) – Number of particles of each species.

  • box_volume (float) – Volume of simulation’s box.

Returns

  • pressure (float) – Scalar Pressure i.e. trace of the pressure tensor

  • pressure_tensor (ndarray) – Pressure tensor. Shape(no_dim,``no_dim``)

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_vacf(vel, sp_num, sp_mass, time_averaging, it_skip)[source]¶

  • it_skip (int) – Timestep interval for time averaging.

  • vacf_y (ndarray) – y-velocity autocorrelation function

  • vacf_z (ndarray) – z-velocity autocorrelation function

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_vk(pos_data, vel_data, k_list)[source]¶

Calculate the instantaneous longitudinal and transverse velocity fluctuations.

Parameters

  • pos_data (ndarray) – Particles’ position. Shape = ( no_dumps, 3, tot_no_ptcls)

  • vel_data (ndarray) – Particles’ velocities. Shape = ( no_dumps, 3, tot_no_ptcls)

  • k_list (list) – List of \(k\) indices in each direction with corresponding magnitude and index of ka_counts. Shape=(no_ka_values, 5)

Returns

  • vkt (ndarray) – Array containing longitudinal velocity fluctuations.

  • vkt_i (ndarray) – Array containing transverse velocity fluctuations in the \(x\) direction.

  • vkt_j (ndarray) – Array containing transverse velocity fluctuations in the \(y\) direction.

  • vkt_k (ndarray) – Array containing transverse velocity fluctuations in the \(z\) direction.

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calc_vkt(fldr, no_dumps, dump_step, species_np, k_list)[source]¶

Calculate the longitudinal and transverse velocities fluctuations of all species. Longitudinal

\[\lambda_A(\mathbf{k}, t) = \sum_i^{N_A} \mathbf{k} \cdot \mathbf{v}_{i}(t) \exp [ - i \mathbf{k} \cdot \mathbf{r}_{i}(t) ]\]

Transverse

\[\tau_A(\mathbf{k}, t) = \sum_i^{N_A} \mathbf{k} \times \mathbf{v}_{i}(t) \exp [ - i \mathbf{k} \cdot \mathbf{r}_{i}(t) ]\]

where \(N_A\) is the number of particles of species \(A\).

Parameters

  • fldr (str) – Name of folder containing particles data.

  • no_dumps (int) – Number of saved timesteps.

  • dump_step (int) – Timestep interval saving.

  • species_np (array) – Number of particles of each species.

  • k_list (list) – List of :math: k vectors.

Returns

  • vkt (ndarray, complex) – Longitudinal velocity fluctuations. Shape = ( no_species, no_dumps, no_ka_values)

  • vkt_perp_i (ndarray, complex) – Transverse velocity fluctuations along the \(x\) axis. Shape = ( no_species, no_dumps, no_ka_values)

  • vkt_perp_j (ndarray, complex) – Transverse velocity fluctuations along the \(y\) axis. Shape = ( no_species, no_dumps, no_ka_values)

  • vkt_perp_k (ndarray, complex) – Transverse velocity fluctuations along the \(z\) axis. Shape = ( no_species, no_dumps, no_ka_values)

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.calculate_herm_coeff(v, distribution, maxpower)[source]¶

Calculate Hermite coefficients by integrating the velocity distribution function. That is

\[a_i = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} dv \, He_i(v)f(v)\]
Parameters

  • v (array) – Range of velocities.

  • distribution (array) – Velocity histogram.

  • maxpower (int) – Hermite order

Returns

coeff – Coefficients \(a_i\)

Return type

array

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.correlationfunction(At, Bt)[source]¶

Calculate the correlation function \(\mathbf{A}(t)\) and \(\mathbf{B}(t)\)

\[C_{AB}(\tau) = \sum_j^D \sum_i^T A_j(t_i)B_j(t_i + \tau)\]

where \(D\) (= no_dim) is the number of dimensions and \(T\) (= no_steps) is the total length of the simulation.

Parameters

  • At (ndarray) – Observable to correlate. Shape=(no_dim, no_steps).

  • Bt (ndarray) – Observable to correlate. Shape=(no_dim, no_steps).

Returns

CF – Correlation function \(C_{AB}(\tau)\)

Return type

array

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.correlationfunction_1D(At, Bt)[source]¶

Calculate the correlation function between \(A(t)\) and \(B(t)\)

\[C_{AB}(\tau) = \sum_i^T A(t_i)B(t_i + \tau)\]

where \(T\) (= no_steps) is the total length of the simulation.

Parameters

  • At (array) – Observable to correlate. Shape=(no_steps).

  • Bt (array) – Observable to correlate. Shape=(no_steps).

Returns

CF – Correlation function \(C_{AB}(\tau)\)

Return type

array

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.kspace_setup(no_ka, box_lengths)[source]¶

Calculate all allowed \(k\) vectors.

Parameters

  • no_ka (array) – Number of harmonics in each direction.

  • box_lengths (array) – Length of each box’s side.

Returns

  • k_arr (list) – List of all possible \(k\) vectors with their corresponding magnitudes and indexes.

  • k_counts (array) – Number of occurrences of each \(k\) magnitude.

  • k_unique (array) – Magnitude of each allowed \(k\) vector.

sarkas.tools.postprocessing.plot_labels(xdata, ydata, xlbl, ylbl, units)[source]¶

Create plot labels with correct units and prefixes.

Parameters

  • xdata (array) – X values.

  • ydata (array) – Y values.

  • xlbl (str) – String of the X quantity.

  • ylbl (str) – String of the Y quantity.

  • units (str) – ‘cgs’ or ‘mks’.

Returns

  • xmultiplier (float) – Scaling factor for X data.

  • ymultiplier (float) – Scaling factor for Y data.

  • xprefix (str) – Prefix for X units label

  • yprefix (str) – Prefix for Y units label.

  • xlabel (str) – X label units.

  • ylabel (str) – Y label units.
